dmca.title: [ABUSE] Plagiarism Complaint
dmca.body:
nc 

-----Original Message-----
From: The Planet Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Tuesday, March 08, 2005 10:05 AM
To: thoth@book-of-thoth.com
Cc: copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: Fwd: [ABUSE] Plagiarism Complaint

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1




Your email is being sent to our copyright-related legal counsel at the
address copyright@theplanet.com for consideration.

- --
Thanks,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/aup/


This is a forwarded message
From: thoth@book-of-thoth.com <thoth@book-of-thoth.com>
To: abuse@theplanet.com
Date: Monday, March 7, 2005, 4:24:27 PM
Subject: [ABUSE] Plagiarism Complaint

===8<==============Original message text=============== Dear Sir/Madam,

I am writing to you in an official capacity, and logging all correspondence
relating to my claim of plagiarism by someone using your hosting services.
This is only the initial notification, which will be followed by a more
detailed response if needed.

I have been running a website called "The Book Of THoTH" which covers all
areas of paranormal research and discussion, as well as more general
subjects. My site has been running for over a year now and has been heavily
optimised for the search engines.

There were two members of my site who had administrative duties, and owing
to the trouble that they caused, I had to ban them. One of them wilfully
damaged my site (the details of which I have) and rendered one of it's main
applications unusable.

It now transpires that they have set up a site with exactly the same name
and exactly the same subject material. The domain name only differs with the
inclusion of the word "the" their domain being www.the-book-of-thoth.com and
mine being www.book-of-thoth.com. I realise nothing can be done about that,
but they are stealing my concepts and ideas in conjunction with the
duplicate site name and almost identical domain name. This will result in my
site potentially being penalised as a result.

I do not take this matter lightly, given that both people have caused
considerable damage, and have sought to cause trouble for the past few
months, at one point using a mailing list of my members to put me and my
site down.

I have been in contact with the offending people to ask them to change their
domain name and the name of the site, or the subject material, as ultimately
this will cause my site to be marked down by the search engines. They have
used images from my site without consent and all of this activity must stop
immediately. Initially it seemed as if they would comply, but now
correspondence has stopped.

They have only recently began their site (March 3rd) and I can prove if need
be all manner of things that they have done to bring my site into ruin.
Including recent correspondence about selling the domain name to a site
which is based on pornographic material, as well as the stated hacking
attempts as well as sending personal attacks to a large percentage of my
administrative staff on several occasions.

Be advised that I will be taking legal measures to have them stopped, but am
working through a series of actions leading up to that. Third on the list
being to contact their hosting company, which is yourselves to see if you
can resolve this matter professionally and promptly.

I would appreciate therefore, if you would investigate this matter at your
earliest convenience and prevent this plagiaristic behaviour from continuing
immediately.

Yours
Michael Bourne
http://www.book-of-thoth.com
